request.description:
This request creates a new platform account on Stripe as well as on the DB.

## Request Body

An email is required in the request body to save the user's email to the DB

## Request Headers

A JWT token paased as an API key in the header field: \`gak-Iue-aty-dh\` is required.  
This JWT token is received and saved on the FE after successful authentication using magic.link on the FE and BE.  
For more details check out: [https://magic.link/docs/home/welcome](https://magic.link/docs/home/welcome)

An \`account-token\` returned from Stripe on the FE is required to associate the Stripe account to the user's email in the DB.

A \`person-token\` returned from Stripe on the FE is only required if the user does not select \`individual\` when creating a new account on the platform

## Response

### Error - 400 - Bad Request

An error response of 400 implies one or more of the required Request Body or Headers has an error

### Error 401 - Unauthorized

An error response of 401 implies there's an issue with verifying the JWT token

### Error 500 - Internal Server Error

### Success - 201

A successful response, returns:

- a \`user_id\`, the unique identifier for the user in the DB \`users\` table
- a Stripe \`account\` object

This request logs a platform user out of their Platform account.

## Request Body

none

## Request Headers

A JWT token paased as an API key in the header field: \`gak-Iue-aty-dh\` is required.  
This JWT token was received and saved on the FE after successful authentication using magic.link on the FE and BE.  
For more details check out: [https://magic.link/docs/home/welcome](https://magic.link/docs/home/welcome)

## Response

### Error 401 - Unauthorized

An error response of 401 implies there's an issue with verifying the JWT token

### Error 500 - Internal Server Error

### Success - 200

A successful response, returns:

``` json
{
    "message": "Logged out successfully"
}

 ```

This request logs an existing user into their platform account.

## Request Body

none

## Request Headers

A DID Bearer token is required.  
This token is generated after successful authentication using magic.link on the FE.  
For more details check out: [https://magic.link/docs/home/welcome](https://magic.link/docs/home/welcome)

## Response

### Error 401 - Unauthorized

An error response of 401 implies there's an issue with verifying the DID Bearer token

### Error 500 - Internal Server Error

A successful response, returns:

- a \`user_id\`, the unique identifier for the user in the DB \`users\` table
- an JWT auth \`token\` for authenticating future requests

This request fetches an existing user account from Stripe and the DB.

## Request Headers

A JWT token paased as an API key in the header field: \`gak-Iue-aty-dh\` is required.  
This JWT token is received and saved on the FE after successful authentication using magic.link on the FE and BE.  
For more details check out: [https://magic.link/docs/home/welcome](https://magic.link/docs/home/welcome)

## Response

### Error 401 - Unauthorized

An error response of 401 implies there's an issue with verifying the JWT token

### Error - 404 - Not Found

An error response of 404 implies either:

- the user was not found in the db
- the user's Stripe account was not found
    

### Error 500 - Internal Server Error

### Success - 200

A successful response, returns:

- a \`user\`, the user object for the user in the DB \`users\` table
- a Stripe \`account\` object

This request updates an existing user account on Stripe and/or in the DB.

## Request Body

### \`dbUpdate\`

This is an object that can have values for any of the following keys:

- email: string
- isOnboarded: boolean
- isVerified: boolean
- credit: number (amount in cents)
    

### \`stripeUpdate\`

For information about this object, check out this link: [https://docs.stripe.com/api/accounts/update](https://docs.stripe.com/api/accounts/update)

## Request Headers

A JWT token paased as an API key in the header field: \`gak-Iue-aty-dh\` is required.  
This JWT token is received and saved on the FE after successful authentication using magic.link on the FE and BE.  
For more details check out: [https://magic.link/docs/home/welcome](https://magic.link/docs/home/welcome)

## Response

### Error 401 - Unauthorized

An error response of 401 implies there's an issue with verifying the JWT token

### Error - 404 - Not Found

An error response of 404 implies either:

- the user was not found in the db
- the user's Stripe account was not found
    

### Error 500 - Internal Server Error

A successful response, returns:

- a \`user\`, the user object for the user in the DB \`users\` table

This request updates an existing user account's onboarded status on the DB.

## Request Body

### \`dbUpdate.isOnboarded\`

Set this value to true

## Request Headers

A JWT token paased as an API key in the header field: \`gak-Iue-aty-dh\` is required.  
This JWT token is received and saved on the FE after successful authentication using magic.link on the FE and BE.  
For more details check out: [https://magic.link/docs/home/welcome](https://magic.link/docs/home/welcome)

## Response

### Error 401 - Unauthorized

An error response of 401 implies there's an issue with verifying the JWT token

### Error - 404 - Not Found

An error response of 404 implies either:

- the user was not found in the db
- the user's Stripe account was not found
    

### Error 500 - Internal Server Error

### Success - 200

A successful response, returns:

- a \`user\`, the user object for the user in the DB \`users\` table
- a Stripe \`account\` object
    

``` json
{
    "data": {
        "user": {
            ...
            "isOnboarded": true,
            ...
        },
        "account": {...}
    },
    "message": "User has been updated successfully"
}

 ```

This request sets an external account, whether card or bank acount, as the default payout method for a contractor on Stripe.

## Request Params

### \`slug\`

An external account id

## Request Headers

A JWT token paased as an API key in the header field: \`gak-Iue-aty-dh\` is required.  
This JWT token is received and saved on the FE after successful authentication using magic.link on the FE and BE.  
For more details check out: [https://magic.link/docs/home/welcome](https://magic.link/docs/home/welcome)

## Response

### Error 401 - Unauthorized

An error response of 401 implies there's an issue with verifying the JWT token

### Error 500 - Internal Server Error

### Success - 200

A successful response, returns:

- an \`updated\` object representing the particular external account with the \`default_for_currency\` field set to \`true\`
    

``` json
{
    "data": {
        "updated": {
            "id": "ba_1OZeGZIZ3hc5uLXADfoVQvvK",
            ...
            "default_for_currency": true,
            ...
        }
    },
    "message": "External account has been made default"
}

 ```

        "status": "requires_payment_method"

    "message": "Payment intent updated successfully"
}

This request creates a full refund for a successful client payment on Stripe.

## Request Body

- transfer_group: the id of a particular gig
- refund_reason: the reason for the transfer
    

> Look in the \`Pre-request Script\` tab of this request for more details 
  

## Response

### Error - 400 - Invalid Request

An error response of 400 implies one or more of:

- the \`refund_reason\` field is invalid
- the \`transfer_group\` field is invalid
    

### Error 500 - Internal Server Error

### Success - 200

A successful response, returns:

- a \`refund\` object from Stripe representing the refund for the payment
- a \`tax_transaction_reversal\` object representing the tax transaction refund from Stripe
- a \`transfer_reversals\` array showing the transfer reversals for all contractors that benefitted from this payment
    

``` json
{
    "data": {
        "refund": {...},
        "tax_transaction_reversal": {...},
        "transfer_reversals": [...]
    },
    "message": "All refunds done successfully"
}

 ```

This request creates a partial refund for a successful client payment on Stripe.

## Request Body

- transfer_group: the id of a particular gig
- amount: the amoun to refund in CENTS
- refund_reason: the reason for the transfer
    

> Look in the \`Pre-request Script\` tab of this request for more details 
  

## Response

### Error - 400 - Invalid Request

An error response of 400 implies one or more of:

- the \`refund_reason\` field is invalid
- the \`transfer_group\` field is invalid
- the \`amount\` field is invalid
    

### Error 500 - Internal Server Error

### Success - 200

A successful response, returns:

- a \`refund\` object from Stripe representing the refund for the payment
- a \`tax_transaction_reversal\` object representing the tax transaction refund from Stripe
    

It is important to note this step only refunds the client from your Stripe platform balance.

To get back the transfers from the contractors, you have to manually call the \`Debit Connected Account\` endpoint for each associated contractor with the amount previously sent to the contractor.

This contractor transfer refund can fail due to contractor's insufficient balance.  
Two ways to solve these are:

- the code: the logic to pay contractors on each successful client payment checks to see if the contractor is owing, and if so, subtracts the amount he's owing before sending to him
- manually: try to debit the contractor again in the future, by calling \`Debit Connected Account\`, when the contractor has gotten some funds in their balance
    

``` json
{
    "data": {
        "refund": {...},
        "tax_transaction_reversal": {...}
    },
    "message": "Charge and tax transaction reversed successfully. Don't forget to refund associated transfers."
}

 ```

## Request Headers

A JWT token paased as an API key in the header field: \`gak-Iue-aty-dh\` is required.

- `action`: create

For request body, refer to here: [https://docs.stripe.com/api/transfers/create](https://docs.stripe.com/api/transfers/create)

> The \`transfer_group\` is the associated gig id for the gig you are debiting the contractor for 
  

## Response

An error response of 400 implies either the request body or the request params are incorrect

### Success - 200

A JWT token paased as an API key in the header field: \`gak-Iue-aty-dh\` is required.  
This JWT token is received and saved on the FE after successful authentication using magic.link on the FE and BE.

### Error 401 - Unauthorized

This request transfers money from the Platform account to contactors associated with a completed gig.

> This is necessary if the gig was not completed at the time the client made payment 
  

## Request Body

- \`gig_id\`: the id of the gig to make transfer for
    

> The status value of this gig must be set to \`completed\` for the transfer to be processed successfully 
  

## Response

### Error - 400 - Bad Request

An error response of 400 implies the `gig_id` is invalid or the gig is not in \`completed\` state

### Error 500 - Internal Server Error

### Success - 200

A successful response, returns:

``` json
{
    "message": "Transfers completed successfully"
}

 ```
